description.narrative: Provide key support to the campaign strategy development by linking Dutch advocacy and campaigning on food value chains to the global campaign development and the national level campaigning in the South. Collecting key data will allow us to better designthe integrated international campaign strategy which consist of a set interlinked national campaign strategies of which the Dutch strategy isan essential building block combined with global elements that all national campaigns will use when implementingthe work. More specifically creating a compelling narrative, arguments, research and public material are crucial to engage different types of audiencestargeted by the campaign. The outputs of this specific project therefore will allow us to launch a setof interlinked national campaigns combined with an overarching global umbrella campaign. The activities will contribute to achieve the outcome targets mentioned in the main project (A-4846) regarding changes in private sector policies and practices.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: Improved policies Private Sector: # cases where Oxfam/partners influenced private sector actors to adopting/implementing improved policies on (i) Sustainable Food production & consumption, (ii) Land Rights (iii) Climate Change with a gender senstive lens.
